丣字的基本解释

丣
yǒu
古同“酉”。

丣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǒu］
［《廣韻》與久切，上有，以。］
“酉1”的古字。

丣字的康熙字典解释

【子集上】【一字部】　丣； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页78第11
【廣韻】與久切【集韻】以九切【正韻】云九切，?音有。闔戸爲丣，日入時也。【說文】就也。八月黍成，可爲酎酒。象古文酉之形。古文酉，从丣。丣爲春門，萬物已出。酉爲秋門，萬物已入，一，閉門象也。【六書正譌】後人以此字類丣，故加酉字別之。酉，乃古酒字，象器中半水。旣以酉字爲丣，復加水旁作酒字。凡畱柳等字皆从丣，醴醪等字會意者皆从酉，二字不可溷用。

[Subset Part 1] [One Word Department] 　丣; Kangxi Strokes: 7; Page Number: Page 78-11
[Guang Yun] and Jiu Cut [Ji Yun] Nine Cuts [Zheng Yun] Yun Nine Cuts, there is a sound. It's a good thing, and every day is in time. [Said Wen] That's it. Millet in August, can be shochu. Like the ancient text of the unitary shape. Ancient Chinese You, Congyou. It is the spring gate, everything has been out. The unity is the gate of autumn, everything has entered, one, it is like a closed door. [Liushu Zhengzheng] This word is used for later generations, so the unitary word is added. You, is the ancient word for wine, half water in the image vessel. The word "you" is used as the word "you", and the word "wine" is added next to the water. The words “liu willow” are all from 丣, and those who know the words “li li” are all from you, and the two words cannot be mixed.
